snippet: The report by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that the death rates were highest among middle-aged men, Native Americans and Native Alaskans.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention report finds that on average six Americans die from alcohol poisoning each day and men between age 45 to 54 are at highest risk of death.
lead_paragraph: The report by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention found that the death rates were highest among middle-aged men, Native Americans and Native Alaskans.

headline.main: Alcohol Poisoning Kills 6 Americans a Day, a Federal Report Finds
headline.print_headline: Alcohol Poisoning Kills 6 Americans a Day, a Federal Report Finds

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
